Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2012 10:05PM sewingnut wrote: I had rMX only,no reconstruction, and did not experience that much pain. They are not cutting thru muscle when doing a MX.just skin, unless there is chest wall adhesion. Breast tissue does'nt have any nerves. The skin that covers the breast has all the nerves. My pain came when the incision started to heal and the skin nerves waking up and starting firing, like little electrical impulses. The pulling drains were the most annoying. Please don't have those removed too soon. As big of pain as they are, you don't want to develop a seroma at the surgical site. The suction from the aspiration of the seroma hurt worse than the MX. I did get a surgical camisole to wear after SX. It has little pockets to hold the drains.  Good luck....

Posts.Title: Am I over-reacting by seeking these tests? KARW41 Momcat1962

Posts.Content: May 24, 2013 06:50AM sewingnut wrote: Peer to peer review is when your Dr talks directly to the Dr or medical professional at the insurance company that denied the test. Usually when you have a peer to peer whatever tests your Dr wants are approved on the spot. A lot of times expensive tests are denied as protocal and all it takes is your Dr/ office staff to call and explain the circumstances for the test. As long as you can explain the need for the test there is no problem. Documented dense breasts and documented extensive family history should qualify for the MRI & the BRCA tests. HMO's usually give you a harder time.

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2011 12:50PM sewingnut wrote: You should have minimal pain with the MX. It is essentially a minimally invasive procedure. They do not cut any muscle tissure only skin. There are no nerves in breast tissue.  There are nerves in the skin holding in the breast tissue. I had very little incision pain, dissolving stitches inside and steristrips on the outside. I am 5 months out and the scar is fading nicely.  I had more pain when they took out the drains than the actual surgery itself. Stop and take a breath, it will be OK.
